title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: nurses warn staff shortage is putting patients at risk in yorkshire .
girl , 12 , injured in 'hit and run ' crash .
vulnerable woman missing from halifax for three weeks .
barnsley man jailed for violent robbery .
last day for feedback on plan for 19,000 homes in calderdale .
record collection of 5,000 goes under the hammer in north yorkshire .
first york balloon festival lifts off this weekend .

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back on monday from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :

documents.title: call for more money to meet police pay increase
text: the man who oversees west yorkshire police says he 'll be asking the government for more cash to meet the rise in police officer 's pay .
earlier this month the government announced that police officers would get a 1 % rise plus a 1 % bonus .
but unions reacted angrily to the pay awards , branding them a real-terms cut , and the prison officers association threatened industrial action .
there was also a warning from police chiefs that making forces pay for the increase themselves would put `` financial pressure on already stretched budgets '' .
i want police officer to have a pay rise , but they 're not funding that and that 's why you 're seeing as many police on the beat as a few years ago . ''

documents.title: missing woman from leeds
text: police in leeds are asking for help in finding this woman :
susan jowett , also known as susan catterill , 38 , of rothwell in leeds was reported missing yesterday
she was wearing a blue jacket and blue trousers .
susan , or anyone who sees susan is asked to call police on 101 quoting log 703 of thursday 28 september .

documents.title: details of liz dawn 's funeral released
text: the family of actress liz dawn have released details of her funeral .

it will take place on 6 october at at salford cathedral at 14:00 and the tv star 's family have requested that donations be made in her memory to the british lung foundation and breast cancer care uk .
the actress from leeds played vera duckworth in coronation street for more than 30 years , and died earlier this week aged 77 .
her family said in a statement that they are `` devastated and heartbroken at the passing of our much-loved wife , mother , sister , grandmother and great grandmother , the incredible liz dawn '' .

documents.title: travel update : delays in leeds at rush hour
text: there are delays of around 40 minutes this afternoon in leeds according to first bus .
they say that the delays are across the entire network as people try to get home from work for the weekend .
not the news you want to hear .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: missing girl from bolton could be in west yorkshire
text: have you seen this missing teenager ?
she 's from bolton but could be in west yorkshire
sadia ahmed was last seen on monday in batley but has been missing from her home near bolton since 12 september .
police say they think the 15-year-old went to leeds city centre after leaving her house .
she was wearing a khaki green thigh-length quilted coat with fur lined along the hood and a grey hooded top underneath .

documents.title: sheffield wednesday boss 'understands fast-food society ' but does not fear sack
text: sheffield wednesday head coach carlos carvalhal said he is not afraid of losing his job .
the owls lost 4-2 at home to cross-city rivals sheffield united on sunday and 1-0 at birmingham on wednesday .
carvalhal has led the club to successive top-six finishes in his two full seasons in charge .
`` i understand the fast-food nature of society but i do n't feel pressure that if i lose a game something will happen to me , '' he told bbc radio sheffield .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: body found near huddersfield town centre
text: police have launched an investigation after the discovery of a body close to huddersfield town centre .
the body of a man was found at about 12:40 this lunchtime in bushes near shorehead sainsbury 's .
officers say that `` enquiries are ongoing to establish the circumstances . ''

documents.title: live : how you can become the voice of bradford
text: if you really want to work for the bbc and have a passion for bradford and the people who live there , this could be your chance !
radio leeds is looking for that special someone to join the team reporting on events throughout 2018 .
keeley donovan is live right now with a few hints and tips on getting into broadcasting .
author: Voice of Bradford

documents.title: discovery of body in huddersfield town centre
text: a body has been discovered in huddersfield town centre .
more to follow

documents.title: barnsley bolshoi ballerina embarks on uk tour
text: a ballerina who was the third british female to graduate from the bolshoi ballet academy is to start her first uk tour as a professional dancer .
tala lee turton , 21 , graduated from the elite moscow-based school last year after four years of intensive training .
she has secured a place at the russian astrakhan state opera and ballet theatre and will be performing with the company in uk theatres from october .
tala , from barnsley , said dancing so close to home would be `` extra special '' .
during her uk tour , which runs from 14 october to 7 december , she will perform in productions of swan lake , nutcracker and romeo and juliet .

documents.title: brewer facing challenge from craft producers
text: beer producer black sheep brewery posted another loss as the business continued to be challenged by the rise of microbreweries and faced additional uncertainty from brexit .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: three drink drivers arrested in one hour in york
text: police in york say they arrested three drunk drivers in one hour in the early hours of this morning .
the first arrest came at 04.40 , when a bmw was spotted by cctv , being driven sus around the city centre and travelling the wrong way down one way roads .
the 21-year-old driver was arrested on sus of drink driving after being found to be twice the legal limit .
he currently remains in custody .
after further examination of the cctv footage , officers realised the other man in the car had also driven the car through the city centre .
they then arrested him on sus of drink driving .
he also remains in police custody .
the third arrest was made at 05.30 when a silver ford ka was spotted by officers driving in the scarcroft road area of york , without any headlights on .
officers stopped the vehicle and breathalysed the 26-year-old male driver .
he was found to be almost three times over the legal limit .
he was arrested on sus of drink driving and of `` taking a vehicle without the owners consent '' and currently remains in police custody .

documents.title: missing otley man found safe and well
text: some good news this afternoon , 65-year-old brian locke has been found safe and well .
and if you 're going to announce the reappearance of a missing person , what better way than to do it than with puppies :
brian locke , 65 , has been found safe and well thanks for all the rts and shares

documents.title: listen : schools in york to get second largest funding increase
text: schools in york are to receive the biggest funding rise in england , outside bournemouth .
it 's part of the new national funding formula .
cash per pupil will rise by £ 700 to £ 4700 .
councillor stuart rawlings says even though statistics say york is the lowest funded area in england , that does n't tell the full story :

documents.title: could you be the voice of bradford ?
text: have you ever wanted to be a bbc reporter ?
do you have a passion for bradford and want to shout about the city and its people ?
radio leeds is looking for that special someone to join the team reporting on events throughout 2018 .
keeley donovan will be one of the judges at the open auditions next weekend .
at 16:00 today , she 'll be live on facebook with a few hints and tips .
if you think you 've got what it takes , find out more about the voice of bradford on the bbc radio leeds website .
author: Voice of Bradford

documents.title: rotherham man charged with nine sexual offences as part of investigation into historic child sexual exploitation in the town
text: a 44-year-old man from rotherham has been charged with rape and sexual assault by the national crime agency as part of their investigation into historical child sexual expoitation in rotherham

as part of operation stovewood , darren hyett , from broom chase , rotherham has been charged with three counts of raping a female under 16 , two counts of raping a female over 16 , two counts of sexual assault against a female under 16 and the trafficking of persons for sexual exploitation .
hyett also faces one charge of perverting the course of justice .
to date , a total of 26 men have been arrested and hyett is the ninth to be charged .
the investigation currently has more than 80 identified suspects and is in the process of engaging with more than 200 victims and survivors .

documents.title: vulnerable woman missing for three weeks
text: a fresh appeal has been launched to find a vulnerable 72-year-old woman who has been missing for almost three weeks .
cathryn holdsworth from halifax has n't been seen since 8 september when she left calderdale royal hospital , she was then up by cctv a day later at tesco in halifax town centre .
police say that they now think she went home to illingworth on a bus that evening , but she was n't reported missing until 19 september by her neighbours .
she was last seen wearing distinctive pink earmuffs , a dark coat , pink gloves and using her walking frame .
police say she maybe in cornwall , blackpool or brighouse .
cathryn lives with a number of health issues which make her more vulnerable and often uses a walking frame . ''

documents.title: northern powerhouse : what on earth are portable nuclear reactors ?
text: you may have read this morning that , among other things , the northern powerhouse partnership want the government to invest £ 1bn on `` portable nuclear reactors '' .
who knew they were a thing ?
we thought we 'd better find out about them - so what are they and can you charge your phone with one on the train ?
well , the first thing you need to know is that they 're smaller than your usual nuclear energy plant , for example heysham nuclear power station in lancashire occupies an area of about 315,000m² .
a portable nuclear reactor , is just around 23m long , small enough to fit onto the back of a lorry .
a single one would never provide enough power to light up an entire city like leeds , but the idea is you can link a few of them together and then collectively they 'd be sufficient .
the only thing is , no one 's built one yet and this is what the northern powerhouse is saying , the north should be at the front of the race to get smaller , in a nuclear kinda way .
but unfortunately it means you ca n't take one in your pocket to keep your phone topped up .
personally i think smrs are probably the future of nuclear .
these things can be making a substantial contribution from the early 2030s onwards . ''
if you 're still a little confused , here 's a little visual representation from the bbc 's environment analyst roger harrabin .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: young women in leeds warned after three students attacked
text: police are warning female students in leeds to walk with friends and stick to well-lit routes at night after three separate attacks on three 21-year-old women .
they all happened in the woodhouse area over the last two weeks .
two students were sexually assaulted and one was robbed .
on tuesday a woman was walking home across woodhouse moor after a night out when a man came up to her , grabbed her by the wrists and pushed her against a bus stop .
she struggled free and carried on home only for the man to approach her again and grab her by the wrists and push her against a building .
she shouted for help and the man walked away and a passing taxi driver took her home - police have issued an efit of a man they want to speak to .
these incidents are an obvious cause for concern and we are doing everything we can to identify the suspects involved . ''

documents.title: yorkshire coach has county 's backing despite tough season
text: yorkshire director of cricket martyn moxon says coach andrew gale has the county 's full support despite a difficult first season in charge .
the headingley side only ensured their division one status in the final championship game of the summer .
they also struggled in the shorter forms of the game , with a group stage exit in the t20 blast and a quarter-final defeat in the one-day cup .
`` andrew 's appointment was a long-term measure , '' moxon told the club website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: machete-wielding masked robbers chased out of leeds bingo club during £ 5,000 raid
text: staff and customers at a leeds bingo hall were threatened by axe and machete-wielding robbers during a £ 5,000 raid .
leeds crown court heard masked men burst into mecca bingo , on balm road , hunslet , but were chased away by brave customers .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: watch : how big is the biggest record collection in the world
text: radio york dj , dr rock - aka chaz white - is selling some of his record collection - we were telling you about it earlier .
he 's got 5,000 records going up for auction which is a lot of vinyl , but is it the largest collection in the world ?
no , nowhere near .
you 've got to travel out of yorkshire for that , in fact even out of the country - all the way to brazil where zero freitas has amassed 5 million .
take a look around his vast collection :
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: gale 's dramatic drop-goal sends castleford into grand final
text: watch luke gale 's golden-point drop-goal in extra-time against st helens to send castleford tigers into the super league grand final for the first time .
you can get a full match report here : castleford tigers 23-22 st helens
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: barnsley man jailed for 'violent ' robbery
text: richard dawson from pye avenue , mapplewell was sentenced to four and a half years yesterday at sheffield crown court for a robbery which left the victim with life-changing injuries .
in a case of mistaken identity , dawson stopped the victim who was driving along bark house lane in cawthorne in april and attacked him while he was still secured by his seatbelt .
detective constable paul woodruff , who investigated the crime , said : this was a violent and unprovoked robbery against an innocent man .
the victim continues to require medical treatment today for his injuries , which included cuts , bruising and a fractured eye socket - over five months later .
it is fair to say that dawson 's nasty and vicious attack has changed this poor man 's life .

documents.title: have you seen this missing man from otley
text: have you seen brian locke ?
he 's gone missing this morning and police need your help to track him down .
the 65-year-old is from otley and was last seen this morning at 08:20 .
he was wearing wearing dark glasses , a black fleece , a maroon polo shirt , blue jeans and black shoes .
if you spot him , call west yorkshire police on 101 .

documents.title: denying breast cancer drug is a `` shameful irresponsibility '' , says sheffield doctor
text: a doctor from sheffield is criticising the decision by some clinical commissioning groups to prevent women from having a potentially life-saving breast cancer treatment .
a new report found in some parts of the country thousands of women are being denied drugs which cost cost 43 pence a day which prevent cancer from returning .
it 's thought to be costing the lives of a thousand women a year .
the charity breast cancer now is calling on the nhs to ensure all parts of the country offer the drugs .
rob coleman , professor of medical oncoclogy at the university of sheffield described the current situation a `` shameful irresponsibility '' .

documents.title: halifax death : picture from the scene
text: this is the latest from the scene of a stabbing in halifax this morning .
two men have been arrested over the stabbing , which happened on mixenden road at around 17:20 yesterday evening .
police found a man in his 30s and he was treated by paramedics but died at the scene .

documents.title: monty missing after york holiday - have you seen him ?
text: a distraught mum-to-be has phoned bbc radio york appealing for the return of her beloved french bulldog , feared stolen from a lakeside retreat .
shaanan rutherford was on holiday in york when monty , an 11 month old black and brindle , male french bulldog , disappeared from the grounds of their lodge at york 's lakeside lodges .
she phoned me today from her home in scotland , distraught that one member of the family is missing .
if you 've seen monty you can use this email to get in touch and we 'll contact shaanan .
author: Jonathan Cowap
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: final vinyl : 5,000 records under the hammer to reclaim house
text: i 've been in my element this morning !
i 've been to kirkbymoorside , to ryedale auctioneers , because bbc radio york 's chaz white , also known as dr rock , is selling his famous vinyl record collection .
five thousand records , including everything from rock 'n ' roll and blues , to jazz and mongolian folk , with much of it signed , is going under the hammer .
a self-described `` lifelong rock 'n ' roll enthusiast '' , chaz ran a college course on the development of rock and roll , which led to his nickname `` dr rock '' by the press .
he also wrote the life stories of little richard and jerry lee lewis .
chas is auctioning off his 5,000 records , because his ever patient wife , annie , has finally had enough of them cluttering up the house .
alongside his impressive collection of memorabilia chaz is also selling famous rock 'n ' roll art , photographs , and the jewel in the crown , bill haley 's gold disc for rock around the clock .
dr rock told me : it 's become just too much .
my dear wife has been highly tolerant but she wants her house back . ''
author: Jericho Keys
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: northern powerhouse : report calls for £ 3bn for 850,000 jobsanalysis
text: this morning the northern powerhouse partnership released their report on how they think the government should invest in the north .
it 's just over three years since the northern powerhouse concept was announced by an excited george osborne .
after a meandering start , it 's now gathering pace almost as fast as a high-speed rail link , and this report puts real meat on the bones .
george osborne 's ownership of the northern powerhouse narrative is the reason the prime minister barely uttered the phrase when she came in to office .
post-election it 's a different story .
last month , i heard her cram it into one sentence three times .
she ca n't abandon it without appearing to abandon the north , and this week she told me it is government driving the powerhouse agenda , not george osborne .

there 's one thing northern conservative mps , labour mayors and the region 's business communities agreed on ; the northern powerhouse lives or dies on a high-speed rail service linking its cities ( crossrail for the north , or hs3 ) .
the government has pledged `` commitment '' to the project , but must make it a reality if it 's to convince the north that it really wants their powerhouse to be built .
author: Nina Warhurst
BBC North West Political Editor

documents.title: watch : anti bullying bus comes to sheffield
text: the 'be nice bus ' , which is touring the uk to promote the message to be kind online , has visited sheffield .
it 's part of the diana award kindness campaign marking twenty years since the princess died .
here 's how they encourage children at all saints catholic high school in sheffield to be kind online :
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: take a seat and light up in leeds
text: people in leeds are being encouraged to take a seat and light up in the city 's victoria gardens .
illuminated benches are being installed there ahead of next week 's light night leeds arts event .
the light benches created by german artists , lichtbankobjekte , have been made using glass light beams connected by wifi , and change colour every two and a half minutes .
following the light night leeds event , the five benches will become a permanent fixture in the city , the only ones of their kind in the uk outside london .

documents.title: will yorkshire mep be the new ukip leader ?
text: we 'll find out later today if jane collins , the yorkshire and humber mep , will become the new leader of ukip .
she 's in the running but is n't one of the favourites
paul nuttall stepped down as leader after he failed to win a seat at the general election .
the new leader will be announced at ukip 's conference this afternoon .

documents.title: anti-fracking campaign : lorry top protester charged
text: police have charged a 40-year-old woman who spent five hours on top of a lorry on its way to a north yorkshire fracking site yesterday .
she 's been charged with `` getting onto a motor vehicle while it was on a road , without lawful authority or reasonable cause . ''
the incident closed habton road for several hours .
a total of 25 people have been arrested at the kirby misperton site so far , since protests started last week .
the woman is due to appear at york magistrates court in november .

documents.title: listen : west yorkshire care workers buying own vaccines
text: trainee health care workers in west yorkshire say they 're having to pay for crucial vaccines for themselves with their own money , to allow them to continue working .
it 's as a result of a global shortage of the vaccine for hepatitis b , which is mandatory for dental nurses .
joe hendron runs a dental practice in wakefield and says this could have a knock on effect for recruitment :

documents.title: man dies after stabbing in halifax
text: detectives have arrested two men on sus of murder in halifax after the death of a man in the town yesterday afternoon .
police were called to mixenden road , following reports a man had been stabbed .
officers found a man in his 30s with serious injuries .
he was treated by paramedics , but died at the scene .
police are questioning two men aged 23 and 28 on sus of murder .

documents.title: listen : 'be nice online ' - diana bus spreads anti-bullying message in sheffield
text: an anti bullying bus is touring schools across the country promoting a message to pupils to be kind online .
it 's part of the diana award kindness campaign marking twenty years since the princess died .
i 've been to see it in action at all saints catholic high school in sheffield :
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: budgies are being smuggled into doncaster this weekend
text: well not technically smuggled but it 's a big weekend for budgies in doncaster .
they 're hosting the budgerigar society world championship show .
and thousands are expected to flock to doncaster dome .
the show starts tomorrow and includes categories like best in show and best young bird .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: last day for feedback on calderdale homes plan
text: today 's the last day for people living in calderdale to have their say on plans to build 19,000 new homes in the area over the next 15 years .
in brighouse alone there are plans to build 6,000 .
calderdale council is asking for feedback on where they should go .
planners say most of them will be affordable , to address a growing need , but not everyone 's happy with the plans , as some homes could be built on greenbelt land .
a consultation 's been running for the last 8 weeks and ends at 17:00 .

documents.title: listen : warning staff shortage putting patients at risk in yorkshire
text: the union representing nurses in yorkshire is warning patients are being put at risk because of staff shortages .
a royal college of nursing survey asked nurses to describe their last shift .
the organisation surveyed more than 30,000 members across the uk .
there were stories of patients wetting their beds , because there was no one to help them to the bathroom and of people dying alone .
more than half of those questioned in yorkshire and the humber say there was a shortfall of nurses on their last shift .
chris perry was a director of nursing for 40 years :
the department for health says it is funding an extra 10,000 places for nurses , midwives and allied health professionals by 2020 .

documents.title: watch : a wet one to begin with - yorkshire 's friday weather
text: heavy rain this morning , but clearing up later .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : lift off for first ever york balloon festival
text: york 's first ever balloon festival lifts off later .
visit york say they expect the event to bring in £ 2m to the economy and attract 30,000 people over the three days at the racecourse .
sally greenaway , is head of the organisation , she says she hopes it comes to york long-term :

documents.title: five released under investigation in national action probe
text: five men arrested as part of a national investigation into neo-nazi group national action have been released pending further inquiries .
the men , aged between 23 and 30 , are from swansea , leeds , wiltshire and sowerby bridge .
national action became the first far-right organisation to be banned in the uk last year .
six other men arrested by counter-terrorism officers in the north west remain in custody .
all of the men who were arrested are suspected of being a member of national action .
home secretary amber rudd has previously said the group was `` a racist , anti-semitic and homophobic organisation '' .

documents.title: traffic and travel : trains to manchester disrupted
text: if you 're heading across the pennines by train this morning , be aware of problems in manchester .
signalling problems at manchester piccadilly are causing disruption to trains at the station :
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: castleford tigers 23-22 st helens
text: castleford tigers 23-22 st helens
author: Phil Cartwright
BBC Sport

documents.title: northern powerhouse £ 3bn investment call
text: the government should invest more than £ 3bn to create 850,000 jobs in the northern powerhouse , a new report has claimed .
in its powerhouse 2050 report , the northern powerhouse partnership suggests investing in schemes including portable nuclear reactors and a hydrogen gas network .
the partnership 's proposals include the government investing :
professor juergen maier , who is a member of the partnership , said the `` bold and original initiatives '' could have a `` transformational effect '' on northern england .
the department for communities and local government has been approached for comment .

documents.title: friday 's yorkshire weather
text: cloudy with occasionally heavy rain during the morning .
drier , sunnier weather will arrive through the afternoon with strong winds easing .
isolated afternoon showers are possible over pennine hills .
breezy overnight with a few showers .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: listen : call for reassurances following collapse of wakefield city academies trust
text: a public meeting is being held tonight following the collapse of an academy trust which ran 21 schools across yorkshire .
earlier this month the wakefield academies trust said it was unable to `` facilitate the rapid improvement '' its academies needed .
the department for education said many of the schools within the trust were performing below the national average .
only four of the schools are rated as good or outstanding by ofsted .
parents , staff and local politicians will meet at hemsworth community centre this evening .
jon trickett , the labour mp for hemsworth , in west yorkshire , will be there and says he 's angry and wants reassurances from ministers :

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: rail services across yorkshire appear to be running pretty much to time so far this morning .
if you 're travelling across the pennines , be aware there is currently disruption to services at manchester piccadilly .
as a result of this , trains may be cancelled , delayed by up to 30 minutes or diverted .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: byram 'hit-and-run ' as school girl hit while crossing road
text: a 12-year-old girl has been seriously injured when she was hit by a car shortly after getting off a school bus in north yorkshire .
the girl was crossing west acres in byram , near knottingley , at about 15:30 when she was hit by a red vauxhall astra that failed to stop , police said .
she was airlifted to leeds general infirmary , where she remains .
a man has been arrested .
officers are appealing for anyone who saw the car in the village to come forward .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on friday 29 september 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
before the wind and rain sets in , let 's begin the day by reminding ourselves what a glorious day yesterday was :
if you have a great pic to share , or want to get in touch with us about what 's happening where you are , just email us here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
